data.title: Little gem of Appleton
data.text: Mai's deli might appear to just be little hole in the wall on college avenue but it packs a very satisfying punch. From the pineapple curry to the infamous stuffed chicken wings, you'll be sure to find something delicious at a great price

data.title: nothing much to look at but great food!
data.text: If it is atmosphere you seek, this probably is not the place for you, but if you want Great food, look no further. Hands down best egg rolls and spring rolls. I have not ordered one thing here I have been disappointed in. Carry out or eat in, be prepared to enjoy!

data.title: Great food, little place
data.text: They have some of the best food in Appleton here, and in a little hole-in-the-wall place right downtown. Seating is limited just like the parking, so how many cars are there can be used as a good guess at how busy it is.

data.title: not great for eat-in
data.text: We were there on a Fri. night.  It took 45 min. to get a simple meal.  It's a tiny place with minimal seating. There was tremendous take-out activity, which seemed to get priority, so that's apparently the way to go.

data.title: Great food for a low price
data.text: A great place to eat with delicious food, generous portions, and low prices. Just make sure to call ahead if you want the stuffed chicken wings (which are amazing!) as it can be a 45 minute wait.

data.title: Just like Thailand
data.text:
I have traveled to thailand many times over the last 20 years.  The food at Mai's is just like Bangkok.
I eat there about 2Xweekly.

data.title: Numerous Visits Never Had a Bad Meal
data.text: My good friend had been going here for years, he, his then wife, and his three girls, now in later years, he and his three girls.  We would go past and I'd see the Southeast Asian Cuisine and I'd ask him about it. He'd share stories how he loved their food, that it is quite reasonable, and from what he could tell quite authentic. I had served in Asia when I was in the military and he said it might remind me of an authentic little restaurant you might find over there. We visit Appleton a lot for the restaurants and shopping, so many great choices. If it wasn't for his recommendation back then I would have never known about this little gem. After that first wing I vowed I'd be back to try their menu, he said he'd come too. So we actually planned a lunch not long after. I had a great lunch and even bought a couple wings for my wife, she loves traditional bone in wings and loves spring rolls so figured I couldn't go wrong. I was right, she loved them.  My wife have been back three or so times since and enjoy it.  Sometimes I forget their there with all the options Appleton has.  The stuffed wings are a big draw. They d-bone chicken wings and stuff them with spring roll filling and somehow grill them so the filling stays in. When you eat it you use the wing tip part as a handle and eat the boneless part with the filling. Hard to explain until you try it. I have eaten quite a few from here. I think I encountered a little piece of chicken gristle once or twice, but usually I don't, so keep in mind they probably painstakingly d bone by hand. I quite enjoy them, they have a thin sweet & sauce or a very spicy hot sauce for dipping them in, not kidding, its spicy. They have a nice menu on the wall, you order and pay before you eat. I have tried the Curry Noodles, Pad Thai, Squash Curry, Pineapple Curry, Pad Cashew, Fresh Spring Rolls, Egg Roll (which is a deep fried spring roll, Veg, Pork, Chicken options), Stuffed Wings (of course), and the Thai Iced Coffee. Of those above dishes its hard to rank. I enjoyed them all I probably prefer the Curries & Noodles over the Pad Cashew, but like I said, I haven't had a bad meal here. They have nice portions, and if it says "spicy" on the menu, you better believe its going to be spicy, they don't joke around and I really like that about them. If its "spicy", they mean it, even some of the regular dishes I found have some mild spice level to them. The Pineapple said, Medium Spice, and it was quite spicy, but I quite liked it. So this leads me to believe we have near native levels of spice going on. My buddy always says one of the greatest compliments is to have members of that restaurants ethnicity eating there too. This place does have a lot of members of the Asian community eating here which bodes well for authenticity. I notice a lot of people order the Pho soups and they look so delicious, but I have a hard time deviating from my curries, one of these days. They have limited seating inside, and a small parking lot, if you get here and its full, that happens, they do take out too.  More often than not i have to drive around in a circle because they are on the corner of a one way by a print shop.  I've never had an issue ordering, read that in one review, the girl/lady that has taken my order quite a few of the times I've been in speaks perfect English, probably first or second gen American. The only other person that ever took my order was one of the main guys and he speaks very good English too, not native, but has always been cordial, you can tell he's usually busy though and probably doesn't have too much time to chat. My good friend who introduced me to it also really likes their dishes. It did indeed remind me of some of the small restaurants you come across a lot of in Asia, nothing fancy, actually its a lot fancier compared to Asia. Really recommend them.

data.title: So so good!
data.text: The family that owns Mai's is so nice. Their staff is friendly, attentive and unobtrusive. The service is quick and their food is very good. I highly recommend the green curry, spring rolls, egg rolls and stuffed chicken wings. The interior is super blah- no atmosphere but its a deli and more intended for take out.

data.title: Must try the stuffed chicken wings
data.text: Imagine a chicken wing with the last joint as the "handle". The upper 2 joints deboned and a stuffed with egg roll fillings! YUM! Add a Thai iced tea and I am a happy camper.

data.title: Great...when they get your order right and don't have untrained staff on the register
data.text: Mai's Deli is a hole in the wall Thai restaurant with no parking and very good food. In spite of the decent quality of the food, be aware that your experience can be challenged by staff. I went there this past week and the young gal on the register who didn't speak any English added my items up incorrectly, put my credit card through twice in front of me, then couldn't explain what had happened, and finally had to call another gal up. The second gal  apologized, but then told me to check my cc bill at the end of the month to see if I had been double charged, not something you want to hear. She then gave me my carryout bag with the wrong food in it, which I didn't discover until I got home. I'm giving careful consideration as to whether I want to take a chance with Mai's again, good food or not.

data.title: One of my favorite places!
data.text: Mai's Deli is a smaller establishment, but don't let that fool you. They have some of the best chicken I've come across, not to mention their delicious egg rolls, and other spectacular dishes.

data.title: I am addicted to the food here. It is excellent.
data.text: My girls & I really like this restaurant. They like the Pad Thai & I love there Curry dish with squash and shrimp, we also are addicted to the Tia Tea, it fabulous.  I have each ten in and gotten it for take out. Very fast, friendly service.

data.title: Love those wings
data.text: Stopped in for their famous stuffed chicken wings. These tasty little hummers are stuffed with veggies and noodles and get a good going over on the grill. The dipping sauce really adds another layer of flavor and before you know it the wings have disappeared. 4 wings will set you back a 10 spot but as we only get them once in a blue moon so we're amenable to that.

data.title: Great Take Out
data.text: Mai's has the best Pad Thai in Appleton hands down. Perfect for takeout, fairly priced and the service is always very sweet.

data.title: Love this place!
data.text: My family loves Mai's Deli. Great pad Thai and spring rolls among others. Smaller restaurant gives it a great vibe. I'd like to think of it as a hidden gem. (Although it's not that hidden).

data.title: AMAZING FOODS
data.text: Perfect area for couple date, or small friends gathering. DELICIOUS FOODS!!! This place is a regular restaurant for me to eat at. :)

data.title: Authentic Pho!
data.text: Every time I go here, I order the Pho soup bowl! I love eating this especially in the cold weather season. I can make my own pho soup at home but when I don't feel like cooking it this is where I would go! It has all the toppings and extra spices I can add to my soup to make it delicious!

data.title: Don't let building fool you - great food here!
data.text: My sister would buy me a dozen egg rolls and some Pad Thai for my birthday meal as take-out.  Best treat I could get on my birthday.  Usually I order the food as take out as the space for seating is quite limited but always a pleasure to get home and dig into my food.  Other loves: Thai Pad See Ew, Vermicelli Salad and Drunken Noodles.  My family members love the stuffed chicken wing and you have not appreciated bananas until you have had them fried with cream cheese.  Excuse me while I clean up my drool...

data.title: Building looks deceptive
data.text: I've visited here numerous times only to find the food delicious.  Don't let the building fool you and scare you off, it's all about the food!  A gem in Appleton!

data.title: Pho Bo not good
data.text:
Stayed in appleton, yearly for the oskosh Air Show, I look for the Thai resto from Web.
found this place stated as 4 star restaurant
Yet when I went there, the look from outside just like very cheap take out place.
I ordered Pho Bo, took about long for me to wait the food, And when the soup came, the taste not even close to thai Pho..as they refers to, I ate anyway but the meatball taste old & sour.. 

quickly I left,as not comfortable with surround the dining, tables & chairs are very not clean.

Not recomended for business travell.
